meanings.definition: The plural form of chrysalis, referring to the pupal stage of a butterfly or moth.
meanings.sent1: The chrysalides were carefully observed by the students in science class.
meanings.sent2: Butterflies emerge from chrysalides after undergoing metamorphosis.
meanings.sent3: The chrysalides decided to have a race to see who would transform first.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like chrysalides, waiting to break free and soar.
meanings.sent5: In the garden, the chrysalides hung like jewels, promising beauty to come.

meanings.definition: A protective covering or shelter, such as a cocoon, in which a pupa develops.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar spun a chrysalides around itself before transforming.
meanings.sent2: The chrysalides kept the pupa safe during its transformation.
meanings.sent3: The chrysalides were so cozy that the pupa didn't want to come out.
meanings.sent4: The chrysalides were like a fortress protecting the delicate pupa inside.
meanings.sent5: Nature's magic was evident in the intricate design of the chrysalides.
